rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable AE.AESER

datasetVariables.description: Is this a serious event? Valid values are "Y" and "N".
datasetVariables.label: Serious Event
datasetVariables.name: AESER

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66767

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable AE.AEACN

datasetVariables.description: Describes changes to the study treatment as a result of the event. AEACN is specifically for the relationship to study treatment. AEACNOTH is for actions unrelated to dose adjustments of study treatment. Examples of AEACN values include ICH E2B values: "DRUG WITHDRAWN", "DOSE REDUCED", "DOSE INCREASED", "DOSE NOT CHANGED", "UNKNOWN" and "NOT APPLICABLE".
datasetVariables.label: Action Taken with Study Treatment
datasetVariables.name: AEACN

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable AE.AEACNOTH

datasetVariables.description: Describes other actions taken as a result of the event that are unrelated to dose adjustments of study treatment. Usually reported as free text. Example: "TREATMENT UNBLINDED. PRIMARY CARE PHYSICIAN NOTIFIED".
datasetVariables.label: Other Action Taken
datasetVariables.name: AEACNOTH

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C111110

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable AE.AEACNDEV

datasetVariables.description: An action taken with a device as the result of the event. The device may or may not be a device under study.
datasetVariables.label: Action Taken with Device
datasetVariables.name: AEACNDEV

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable AE.AEREL

datasetVariables.description: Records the investigator's opinion as to the causality of the event to the treatment. ICH does not establish any required or recommended terms for non-device relatedness. ICH E2A and E2B examples include (up-cased here for alignment to SDTM conventions) terms such as "NOT RELATED", "UNLIKELY RELATED", "POSSIBLY RELATED", "RELATED", but these example terms do not establish any conventions or expectations. Controlled terminology may be defined in the future. Check with regulatory authority for population of this variable.
datasetVariables.label: Causality
datasetVariables.name: AEREL

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable AE.AERLDEV

datasetVariables.description:
A judgment as to the likelihood that the device caused the adverse event. The relationship is to a device identified in the data (i.e., has an SPDEVID). The device may be ancillary or under study. 
 Terminology: 
 * In the EU, follow the European Commission Guidelines on Medical Devices, Clinical Investigations: SAE Reporting (MEDDEV 2.7/3) (e.g., Not Related, Unlikely, Possible, Probable, Causal Relationship), with device-specific definitions. 
 * No required Controlled Terminology in US.
datasetVariables.label: Relationship of Event to Device
datasetVariables.name: AERLDEV

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable AE.AERELNST

datasetVariables.description: Records the investigator's opinion as to whether the event may have been due to a treatment other than study drug. May be reported as free text. Example: "MORE LIKELY RELATED TO ASPIRIN USE".
datasetVariables.label: Relationship to Non-Study Treatment
datasetVariables.name: AERELNST

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable AE.AEPATT

datasetVariables.description: Used to indicate the pattern of the event over time. Examples: "INTERMITTENT", "CONTINUOUS", "SINGLE EVENT".
datasetVariables.label: Pattern of Adverse Event
datasetVariables.name: AEPATT

datasetVariables.name: AEOUT

datasetVariables.description: Was the serious event life-threatening? Valid values are "Y" and "N".
datasetVariables.label: Is Life Threatening
datasetVariables.name: AESLIFE

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable AE.AESOD

datasetVariables.description: Did the serious event occur with an overdose? Valid values are "Y" and "N". This is a legacy seriousness criterion. It is not included in ICH E2A or E2B.
datasetVariables.label: Occurred with Overdose
datasetVariables.name: AESOD

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable AE.AESMIE

datasetVariables.description: Do additional categories for seriousness apply? Valid values are "Y" and "N".
datasetVariables.label: Other Medically Important Serious Event
datasetVariables.name: AESMIE

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable AE.AESINTV

datasetVariables.description: Records whether medical or surgical intervention was necessary to preclude permanent impairment of a body function, or to prevent permanent damage to a body structure, with either situation suspected to be due to the use of a medical product. This variable is used in conjunction with the other "seriousness" variables (e.g., fatal, life-threatening). It is part of the US federal government definition of a serious adverse event; see 21 CFR Part 803.3(w)(3).
datasetVariables.label: Needs Intervention to Prevent Impairment
datasetVariables.name: AESINTV

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable AE.AEUNANT

datasetVariables.description:
Any serious adverse effect on health or safety or any life-threatening problem or death caused by or associated with a device, if that effect, problem, or death was not previously identified in nature, severity, or degree of incidence in the investigational plan or application (including a supplementary plan or application), 
 or 
 any other unanticipated serious problem associated with a device that relates to the rights, safety, or welfare of subjects. (21 CFR Part 812.3(s)). 
 This variable applies only to serious AEs and should hold collected data; if the value is derived, it should be held in ADaM.
datasetVariables.label: Unanticipated Adverse Device Effect
datasetVariables.name: AEUNANT

modelClassVariable.title: Rel of AE to Device-Related Procedure

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable AE.AERLPRT

self.title: Rel of AE to Non-Dev-Rel Study Activity

datasetVariables.description:
The investigator's opinion as to the causality of the event as related to other protocol-required activities, actions, or assessments (e.g., medication changes, tests/assessments, other procedures). The relationship is to a protocol-specified, non-device-related activity where the device is identified in the data (i.e., has an SPDEVID). The device may be ancillary or under study. 
 Terminology: 
 * In the EU, follow the European Commission Guidelines on Medical Devices, Clinical Investigations: SAE Reporting (MEDDEV 2.7/3) (e.g., Not Related, Unlikely, Possible, Probable, Causal Relationship), with device-specific definitions. 
 * No required Controlled Terminology in US.
datasetVariables.label: Rel of AE to Non-Dev-Rel Study Activity
datasetVariables.name: AERLPRT

modelClassVariable.title: Rel of AE to Non-Dev-Rel Study Activity

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable AE.AERLPRC

self.title: Rel of AE to Device-Related Procedure

datasetVariables.description:
The investigator's opinion as to the likelihood that the device-related study procedure (e.g., implant/insertion, revision/adjustment, explant/removal) caused the AE. The relationship is to a device-related procedure where the device is identified in the data (i.e., has an SPDEVID). The device may be ancillary or under study. 
 Terminology: 
 * In the EU, follow the European Commission Guidelines on Medical Devices, Clinical Investigations: SAE Reporting (MEDDEV 2.7/3) (e.g., Not Related, Unlikely, Possible, Probable, Causal Relationship), with device-specific definitions. 
 * No required Controlled Terminology in US.
datasetVariables.label: Rel of AE to Device-Related Procedure
datasetVariables.name: AERLPRC

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable AE.AETOXGR

datasetVariables.description: Toxicity grade according to a standard toxicity scale (e.g., Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events, CTCAE). datasetVariables.label: Standard Toxicity Grade
datasetVariables.name: AETOXGR

datasetVariables.description: Describes the end of the event relative to the sponsor-defined reference period. The sponsor-defined reference period is a continuous period of time defined by a discrete starting point (RFSTDTC) and a discrete ending point (RFENDTC) of the trial. \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables.

datasetVariables.name: AEENRTPT

description: An events domain that contains data describing untoward medical occurrences in a patient or subjects that are administered a pharmaceutical product and which may not necessarily have a causal relationship with the treatment.
label: Adverse Events
name: AE
